Best early Black Friday Nintendo Switch deals 2025: I'm tracking my favorite discounts live now
The holiday shopping season is almost here, which means one thing: Black Friday deals are about to flood the web. It's the time of the year when you can score huge discounts on smartphones, laptops, and especially video games. Retailers are already rolling out early discounts on consoles, popular titles, and accessories. And few brands bring the deals quite like Nintendo.
Also: Best early Black Friday Walmart deals
2025 has been a big year for Nintendo as the gaming giant launched a brand new console: the Switch 2. While the latest model has stolen the spotlight, the original Switch remains a great handheld device that continues receiving new releases and support. Whether you're shopping for your first console or planning to upgrade, I've rounded up the best early Black Friday Switch deals so you can get your holiday shopping done before the rush.
Best early Black Friday Nintendo Switch deals
- Current price: $500
The Switch 2 is a significant upgrade over the previous model, sporting better hardware, a larger, more vibrant touchscreen, and a revamped pair of controllers with optical sensors that allow them to function as computer mice. Switch 2 deals are tough to come by at this point in time, but I did find this bundle deal that packages the console with a copy of Mario Kart World. Also, this console is backwards compatible with the vast majority of your original Switch games.
- Current price: $320 (9% off)
- Original price: $350
The Nintendo Switch has been a massive success for the company, and for good reason. It is a versatile gaming device that supports three different playstyles, has an enormous game library, and has a long-lasting battery. I recommend that you buy the OLED model for its superior visual output. Colors are much more vibrant, and black hues are darker on this version of the Switch than on the original, which has an LCD screen.
- Current price: $450 (10% off)
- Original price: $500
This Nintendo Switch provides a lot of value for its price. In addition to the console, this bundle comes with Mario Kart 8 Deluxe preloaded on the device, a copy of Super Mario RPG, a free 12-month subscription to Nintendo Switch Online, a screen protector, a protective case, and more.
- Current price: $70 (13% off)
- Original price: $80
The Switch's Joy-Cons are praised for their versatility, comfortable design, and robust features like motion controls. It's not an exaggeration to say that the Joy-Cons are some of my favorite gaming controllers of all time. I have a pair and plan on continuing to use them until they fall apart. Over at Target, you can get a pair of refurbished controllers from Nintendo for 13% off.
- Current price: $20 (35% off)
- Original price: $30
The Switch's Charging Grip does multiple jobs at once. You can attach your Joy-Con to the grip and use them together as a more traditional controller for more comfortable gameplay. It can also be used to recharge the Joy-Cons while you play. There's a USB-C port around the back of the grip that feeds directly into the battery.
- Current price: $40 (43% off)
- Original price: $70
Madden 26 is the latest entry in the long-running series. This entry introduces a "new AI-powered machine learning system" that takes real-world NFL data and converts everything into "explosive gameplay." It aims to provide an experience so authentic that you'll feel like an actual head coach in the NFL leading your team to victory.
- Current price: $55 (8% off)
- Original price: $60
Super Mario Odyssey launched close to the release of the first Switch and quickly became a classic on the console. This entry sees Mario embark on another epic adventure to save Princess Peach from getting married to Bowser. It's also a return to form for the series since it is the first sandbox-style 3D Mario game since 2002's Super Mario Sunshine.
- Current price: $25 (49% off)
- Original price: $49
Relive the glory days of arcades with this Marvel vs. Capcom collection. It packs six games on one cartridge, including the legendary Marvel vs. Capcom 2, X-Men: Children of the Atom, and Marvel Super Heroes. These classic titles have been revamped for high-definition visuals and come with modern features, including a training mode. Online play is supported, so you can play with people around the world.
- Current price: $30 (49% off)
- Original price: $59
Become vengeance; become the night. Batman Arkham Trilogy consists of three action-packed games where you play as Batman as he takes on the worst of Gotham City. The first game, Arkham Asylum, will task you with freeing the asylum from the clutches of the Joker. Arkham City, the second game, sees Batman trapped in a new maximum-security facility made up of parts of Gotham. Arkham Knight is the thrilling conclusion that pits Batman against his greatest challenge.
- Current price: $90 (40% off)
- Original price: $150
Block out the world and immerse yourself fully in the game. The HyperX Cloud III is a wireless headset. It houses 53mm drivers, a 10mm mic for crystal-clear voice chats, a comfortable design, and support for DTS Spatial Audio. As the cherry on top, this pair of headphones boasts a battery life of up to 120 hours on a single charge. I recommend the wireless version, but if you're looking to save some cash, there is also the Cloud III Wired Headset for $67.

FAQs
When is Black Friday?
In 2025, Black Friday is set for Friday, November 28. It's one of the best times of the year to score deep discounts on Nintendo Switch consoles, games, and accessories from major retailers like Best Buy, Walmart, and Amazon. Many of these sales are expected to carry over until Cyber Monday, December 1.
Is the Nintendo Switch really cheaper during Black Friday?
Absolutely. The Nintendo Switch is almost always cheaper on Black Friday and Cyber Week. Retailers also slash prices on popular console packages, accessories, and games, with saving that can easily reach $100 or more. This sales event is usually the price time to get a Switch or Switch 2. Nintendo rarely lowers the price on its devices and games, so it can be tough to find discounts during other parts of the year.
How did we choose these early Black Friday deals?
At ZDNET, we only highlight Nintendo Switch deals worth your money -- the same kind we'd consider ourselves. For this roundup, I specifically sought out Switch models, games, and accessories that were about 15% off or more. Black Friday is still several weeks away, so the significant discounts aren't available yet. Knowing this, I expanded my search to include lesser discounts to fill out the list. Although some price drops aren't as deep as others, they're still worth consideration because they offer unique value in other areas.
I considered hands-on experience, real-world performance, and customer feedback. Every recommendation on this list is backed by careful research and expert insight so that you can confidently shop these early Black Friday sales.
